info.name: Tymbl API Collection
info.description:
Comprehensive Postman collection for Tymbl backend API. All endpoints grouped by controller with detailed request/response examples.

Updated with comprehensive interview question endpoints

request.description:
Unified search endpoint that searches jobs using Elasticsearch. 
Supports keyword search, location filtering, experience filtering, company, designation, and pagination.

Request Body Fields:
- keywords: List of search keywords (optional)
- cityId: Filter by city ID (optional)
- countryId: Filter by country ID (optional)
- companyId: Filter by company ID (optional)
- designationId: Filter by designation ID (optional)
- minExperience: Minimum experience in years (optional)
- maxExperience: Maximum experience in years (optional)
- page: Page number (default: 0)
- size: Page size (default: 20)

Response includes:
- jobs: Array of job objects with full details
- total: Total number of matching jobs
- page: Current page number
- size: Page size
- totalPages: Total number of pages

response.name: Success
response.body:
{
  "jobs": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "title": "Senior Software Engineer",
      "description": "We are looking for a talented Senior Software Engineer...",

request.description: Generate comprehensive interview questions for all skills in the system using AI
Generate comprehensive interview questions for a specific skill using AI
Generate and save comprehensive tech skills using AI

request.description: Generate and save interview questions for a skill and topic using Gemini. Generates summary and detailed questions, and for coding questions, generates code in Java, Python, and C++.

response.body:

request.description: Generate and save interview questions for all topics of a skill using Gemini. Loops through all topics and uses the same logic as the single-topic endpoint.

response.name: Success

request.description: Generate and save interview questions for all enabled skills and all their topics using Gemini. Loops through all skills and topics and uses the same logic as the single-skill endpoint.
